intro: Galium concatenatum, commonly known as common bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Galium concatenatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
